intro: Cissus adenocaulis var. pubescens, commonly known as the velvety wood sorrel, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive reddish-brown stem. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical conditions and requires well-draining soil. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
